Detailed Description

functions to control the HR20 LCD

Author:
Dario Carluccio <hr20-at-carluccio-dot-de>
Date:
24.12.2007
Rev
112

Define Documentation

#define LCD_BITPLANES   2

two bitplanes for blinking

#define LCD_CONTRAST_MAX   15

contrast maxmum

#define LCD_CONTRAST_MIN   0

contrast minimum

#define LCD_MAX_CHARS   37

no. of chars in LCD_CharTablePrgMem

#define LCD_MAX_POS   4

number of 7 segment chars

#define LCD_REGISTER_COUNT   9

no. of registers each bitplane

Function Documentation

ISR ( LCD_vect   ) 

LCD Interrupt Routine

Note:
copy LCD_Data to LCDREG

cycle bitplanes every LCD_BLINK_FRAMES

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void LCD_AllSegments ( uint8_t  mode  ) 

Switch LCD on/off

Parameters:
mode 
  • 0: clears all digits
  • other: set all digits

Clear LCD Display

Note:
Sets all Segments of the to LCD_MODE_OFF

Clear hour-bar

Note:
Sets all Hour-Bar Segments to LCD_MODE_OFF

void LCD_ClearNumbers ( void   ) 

Clear all 7 segment fields

Note:
Sets the four 7 Segment and the Columns to LCD_MODE_OFF

void LCD_ClearSymbols ( void   ) 

Clear all Symbols

Note:
Sets Symbols AUTO MANU PROG SUN MOON SNOW to LCD_MODE_OFF

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool LCD_ContrastAdjust ( int8_t  mode  ) 

Init LCD

Note:
  • increase/decrese contrast
  • set LCD Contrast Control Register
Parameters:
mode 
  • 0: set LCD Contrast Control Register to default
  • 1: increase contrast by 1
  • -1: decrease contrast by 1
Returns:
false if contrast at limit

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void LCD_Init ( void   ) 

Init LCD

Note:
  • Initialize LCD Global Vars
  • Set up the LCD (timing, contrast, etc.)

void LCD_PrintChar ( uint8_t  value,
uint8_t  pos,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Print char in LCD field

Note:
segments insinde one 7 segment array are adressed using adress of segment "F" LCD_FieldOffsetTablePrgMem[] as base adress adding LCD_SegOffsetTablePrgMem[] *

You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe

Parameters:
value char to print see LCD_CharTablePrgMem[]
pos position in lcd from left to right 01 : 23
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1
value 
  • 0: clears all digits,
  • other: set all digits

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void LCD_PrintDayOfWeek ( uint8_t  dow,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Print day of week on LCD

Note:
something weird due to 7 Segments

using german format: Mo, Di, Mi, Do, Fr, Sa, So

You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe

Parameters:
dow day of week
  • 0 : monday
  • 7 : sunday
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

Here is the call graph for this function:

void LCD_PrintDec ( uint8_t  value,
uint8_t  pos,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Print decimal value in LCD field

Note:
You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe
Parameters:
value value to be printed (0-99)
pos position in lcd 0:left, 1:right
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

void LCD_PrintTemp ( uint8_t  temp,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Print temperatur on LCD

Note:
You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe
Parameters:
temp<BR> 
  • 0 : OFF
  • 255 : ON
  • other : temperature = 4,9°C + (temp/10)
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

Here is the call graph for this function:

void LCD_SetHourBarBar ( uint8_t  val,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Set all segment from left up to val and clear all other segments

Note:
You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe
Parameters:
seg No of the last hour bar segment to be set 0-23
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

Here is the call graph for this function:

)

Note:
You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe
Parameters:
seg No of the hour bar segment 0-23
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

void LCD_SetSeg ( uint8_t  seg,
uint8_t  mode 
)

Set segment of LCD

Note:
You have to call LCD_Update() to trigger update on LCD if not it is triggered automatic at change of bitframe
Parameters:
seg No of the segment to be set see LCD_SEG_B0 ...
mode LCD_MODE_ON, LCD_MODE_OFF, LCD_MODE_BLINK_1

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void LCD_Update ( void   ) 

Request LCD Update immediately

Note:
update it is triggered automaticaly at change of each bitframe

Must be called after usage of LCD_SetSeg and LCD_PrintChar to trigger update of LCDDR Registers

Here is the caller graph for this function:
